lesson_metadata.universal_concept: Earth's Magnificent Oceans - The Blue Heart of Our Living Planet
lesson_metadata.learning_essence: Understand the ocean as one global system, how currents move water and life, and how our choices protect this shared home.

neutral.voice_over_script: Today you'll see the ocean as one moving system that connects every coast and living thing.

fun.voice_over_script: Welcome to the Big Blue—one giant engine that moves water, heat, and life around our planet!

grandmother.display_text: The Ocean That Hugs the World
grandmother.voice_over_script: Come close, dear. The ocean is like a warm hug around the world—always moving, always caring.

fun.display_text: Which is true about the Big Blue?

grandmother.display_text: How would you describe our oceans, dear?

option_a.display_text: Separate oceans that don't affect each other

option_b.display_text: One global ocean connected by currents

teaching_moments.option_a_response: They have names, yes—but water, heat, salt, and life constantly mix. The ocean acts as one connected system.
teaching_moments.option_b_response: Exactly. We name parts, but currents link them into one body—energy and life flow around the world.

fun.display_text: What powers the ocean's conveyor belts?

grandmother.display_text: What makes the ocean keep on moving, dear?

option_a.display_text: Only the tides from the Moon

teaching_moments.option_a_response: Tides matter near coasts, but big global flows need more than a gentle tug—temperature and salt make water sink and rise.
teaching_moments.option_b_response: Right. Wind pushes the surface, the Sun makes temperature differences, and salt changes density—together they steer great conveyors.

neutral.display_text: Why are healthy oceans essential for people?

fun.display_text: Why does the Big Blue matter to you?

grandmother.display_text: Why should we care for the ocean, love?

option_a.display_text: It's mainly about fish and beaches

option_b.display_text: Oxygen, climate balance, food, and livelihoods

teaching_moments.option_a_response: Yes, and so much more—the ocean makes oxygen, feeds families, and keeps our climate steady.
teaching_moments.option_b_response: Exactly. The ocean breathes with us, feeds us, carries ships and stories—our daily life depends on it.

neutral.display_text: Care for the ocean, and it will keep caring for you—every breath, every meal, every calm day.
neutral.voice_over_script: Care for the ocean, and it will keep caring for you—every breath, every meal, every calm day.
